Package DAO

Class OrderDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • DAO.OrderDAO
  • public class OrderDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    The `OrderDAO` class provides methods to interact with the orders table in the database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      OrderDAO​(java.sql.Connection conn)
      Constructs an OrderDAO with the specified database connection.

    • Method Summary

      Deletes an order from the database.

      Retrieves all orders from the database.

      • OrderDAO

        public OrderDAO​(java.sql.Connection conn)
        Constructs an OrderDAO with the specified database connection.
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection to be used

    • Method Detail

      • GetAllOrders

        public java.util.List<Order> GetAllOrders()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves all orders from the database.
        Returns:
        a list of all orders, where each order is represented as an instance of the Order class.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL statement fails.

      • GetOrderById

        public Order GetOrderById​(int orderId)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves an order from the database by its unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        orderId - the unique identifier of the order to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        an instance of the Order class representing the order with the specified ID, or null if no such order exists.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL statement fails.

      • GetOrderByDateHour

        public java.util.List<Order> GetOrderByDateHour​(java.time.LocalDate date,
                                                int hour)
                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves orders from the database by date and hour.
        Parameters:
        date - the date of the orders to be retrieved.
        hour - the hour of the orders to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        a list of orders that match the specified date and hour.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL statement fails.

      • AddOrder

        public int AddOrder​(java.lang.String orderDate,
                    java.lang.String orderTime,
                    java.math.BigDecimal totalAmount,
                    int cashierId)
             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                    java.text.ParseException
        Adds a new order to the database.
        Parameters:
        orderDate - the date of the order.
        orderTime - the time of the order.
        totalAmount - the total amount of the order.
        cashierId - the ID of the cashier who processed the order.
        Returns:
        the generated ID of the new order, or -1 if the insertion failed.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
        java.text.ParseException - if the date or time format is invalid.

      • UpdateOrder

        public int UpdateOrder​(int orderId,
                       java.lang.String newOrderDate,
                       java.lang.String newOrderTime,
                       java.math.BigDecimal newTotalAmount,
                       int newCashierId)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates an existing order in the database with new details.
        Parameters:
        orderId - the unique identifier of the order to be updated.
        newOrderDate - the new date for the order, in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
        newOrderTime - the new time for the order, in the format "HH:mm:ss".
        newTotalAmount - the new total amount for the order as a BigDecimal.
        newCashierId - the new unique identifier of the cashier processing the order.
        Returns:
        1 if the update is successful, 0 if the update fails.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL statement fails.

      • DeleteOrder

        public int DeleteOrder​(int orderId)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes an order from the database.
        Parameters:
        orderId - the unique identifier of the order to be deleted.
        Returns:
        1 if the deletion is successful, 0 if the deletion fails.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL statement fails.
